title: Catarina Gauntlets (Dark Souls II)

description:
Distinctively shaped gauntlets worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Often ridiculed for the onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for deflecting blows.
title: Catarina Gauntlets (Dark Souls III)

description:
Distinctively shaped helm worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Outside Catarina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.
title: Catarina Helm

description:
An odd helmet shaped like an onion.
This helmet appears rather absurd, but its multi-faced construction is in fact quite practical as it effectively deflects physical attacks.
The old tales speak of brave Catarina knights wearing this helmet as they rushed courageously into battle.
title: Catarina Helm (Dark Souls II)

description:
Distinctively shaped helm worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Often ridiculed for its onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for deflecting blows.
title: Catarina Helm (Dark Souls III)

description:
Distinctively shaped leggings worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Outside of Caterina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.
title: Catarina Leggings

description:
Odd leggings shaped like an onion.
These leggings appear rather absurd, but their multi-faced construction is in fact quite practical as they effectively deflect physical attacks.
The old tales speak of brave Catarina knights wearing these leggings as they rushed courageously into battle.
title: Catarina Leggings (Dark Souls II)

description:
Distinctively shaped leggings worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Often ridiculed for the onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for deflecting blows.
title: Catarina Leggings (Dark Souls III)

description:
Massive iron armor worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.
Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.
title: Cathedral Knight Armor

description:
Massive iron gauntlets worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.
Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.
title: Cathedral Knight Gauntlets

description:
A heavy iron shield used by the knights of the Cathedral of the Deep. The blessings of the Cathedral have granted it high dark absorption.
The face of the shield is decorated with the emblem of an old king of Lothric: a bold image of a great bird gazing skywards.
title: Cathedral Knight Greatshield

description:
Ultra greatsword wielded by the knights of the Cathedral of the Deep.
Highly destructive if intolerably heavy.
Its blade is flattened for use as a strike weapon, but the point at the end allows for thrusting.
title: Cathedral Knight Greatsword

description:
Massive iron helm worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.
Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.
title: Cathedral Knight Helm

description:
Massive iron leggings worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.
Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.
title: Cathedral Knight Leggings

description:
Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.
Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.
title: Chain Armor

description:
Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to its ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.
Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keep them alive is armor enough.
title: Chain Armor (Dark Souls III)

description:
A chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.
Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.
title: Chain Helm

description:
Chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to its ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.
Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.
title: Chain Helm (Dark Souls III)

description:
Chainmail leggings of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.
Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.
title: Chain Leggings

description:
Chainmail leggings of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to their ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.
Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.
title: Chain Leggings (Dark Souls III)

description:
Trident of the Six-eyed Channelers, sorcerers who serve Seath the Scaleless in collecting human specimens.
Thrusted in circular motions in a unique martial arts dance that stirs nearby allies into a bloodthirsty frenzy.
title: Channeler's Trident

description:
A trident wielded by an old sorcerer. The tip is sharpened so smoothly that it suggests a degree of madness.
Use strong attack to perform a power-channeling dance, the madness of which boosts the morale of nearby allies.
title: Channeler's Trident (Dark Souls II)

description: A curved sword born from the soul of Quelaag, daughter of the Witch of Izalith, who was transformed into a chaos demon. This blade inherits only the chaotic nature of Quelaag, and has a unique speckled design. Blade wielder erodes along with opponents.
title: Chaos Blade

description:
A katana of unknown origin. Damage to foes also damages its owner.
The peculiar pattern upon the blade suggests the sinister nature of this cursed blade. It is an alluring vortex, and a lonely soul.
title: Chaos Blade (Dark Souls II)

description:
A cursed sword of unknown origin bearing uncanny streaks on its blade.
Attacks also damage its wielder.
The sword is not unlike a thing misshapen, granted life, but never welcome in this world. In other words, chaos itself.
title: Chaos Blade (Dark Souls III)

description:
Boots worn by a chaos sorcerer.
He calls himself Navlaan, now.
title: Chaos Boots

description:
Gloves worn by a chaos sorcerer.
He calls himself Navlaan, now.
title: Chaos Gloves

description:
Hood worn by a chaos sorcerer.
He calls himself Navlaan, now.
title: Chaos Hood

description:
Rapier of darkness and chaos.
Navlaan claims to have sealed himself away to prevent tragedy, but could a sorcery truly possess a will of its own?
Truth can be elusive, and the tales surrounding him are questionable. Only, it is clear a strange power possesses this sword.
title: Chaos Rapier

description:
Robe worn by a chaos sorcerer.
He calls himself Navlaan, now.
title: Chaos Robe

description:
Shield of darkness and chaos.
Navlaan claims to have sealed himself away to prevent tragedy, but how could a sorcery truly possess a will of it's own?
Truth can be elusive, and the tales surrounding him are questionable. Only it is clear a strange power possesses this shield.
title: Chaos Shield

description:
Lance forged from the soul of the Executioner's Chariot. Its cross-shaped blade causes bleeding.
The perverse design of this spear mirrors the chariot from which it came, a merciless creation that endlessly tortured the Undead.
title: Chariot Lance

description:
Charred armor of the Knights of Loyce, burned black by flame.
These Knights of Loyce plunged into the old Chaos with their lord, and lost their sense of self. To this day, they still burn in agony, alongside their once-proud king.
title: Charred Loyce Armor

description:
Charred gauntlets of the Knights of Loyce, burned black by flame.
These Knights of Loyce plunged into the old Chaos with their lord, and lost their sense of self. To this day, they still burn in agony, alongside their once-proud king.
title: Charred Loyce Gauntlets

description:
A charred greatsword of the Knights of Loyce, its blade burned black by flame.
These Knights of Loyce lacked all sense of self, and were driven only by the urge to expunge any who might disturb the flame, even former compatriots.
title: Charred Loyce Greatsword

description:
Charred helm of the Knights of Loyce, burned black by flame.
These Knights of Loyce plunged into the old Chaos with their lord, and lost their sense of self. To this day, they still burn in agony, alongside their once-proud king.
title: Charred Loyce Helm

description:
Charred leggings of the Knights of Loyce, burned black by flame.
These Knights of Loyce plunged into the old Chaos with their lord, and lost their sense of self. To this day, they still burn in agony, alongside their once-proud king.
title: Charred Loyce Leggings

description:
Charred shield of the Knights of Loyce, burned black by flame.
These Knights of Loyce lacked all sense of self, and were driven only by the urge to expunge any who might disturb the flame, even former compatriots.
title: Charred Loyce Shield

description:
Leather gloves worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.
These gloves have no distinguishing features, but are of extremely high quality.
title: Chester's Gloves

description:
Black leather long coat hat worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.
This exquisitely sewn aristocratic suit allows its wearer to move in silence, lending well to stealth.
title: Chester's Long Coat

description:
Black leather trousers worn by Marvellous Chester, a man of mystery lost in the past.
These exquisitely sewn trousers are decorated with silver trinkets of varying sizes, and have straps on the inner legs for carrying crossbow bolts.
title: Chester's Trousers

description:
Sacred chime forged from the soul of Nadalia, Bride of Ash. Nothing appears sacred about the frightful design of this chime, but it does have the benefit of raising one's faith.
The oozing, frozen iron forming the bell seems to anticipate a scream.
title: Chime of Screams

description:
Sacred chime created from the soul of Nashandra. Greatly amplifies spells.
The old one of the Abyss was reborn in death, split into miniscule fragments, and spread across the land. The tiniest of these pieces, precisely due to its size, was the first to restore its form.
title: Chime of Want

description:
Traditional coat of the Vinheim Dragon School.
Normally a deep blue color, this black variation is a sign of a sorcerer engaged in surreptitious work. 
These were covert agents who excelled at manipulating sound.
title: Clandestine Coat

description:
A weapon formed by three sharped claws.
Attacks cause bleeding, and the wounds inflicted are not easily mended. Preferred weapon of the spooks of an Eastern land.
title: Claw

description:
Weapon favored by intelligencers of an eastern land. The lacerations it inflicts do not mend easily.
When two-handed, claws are equipped to each hand.
title: Claw (Dark Souls III)

description:
A Weapon that attaches to the hands.
The wearer attacks in a scratching motion with these three-pronged claws. Claws inflict deep wounds and cause deep bleeding.
title: Claws (weapon)

description:
This larger type of greatsword is normally wielded with two hands due to its weight.
This highly flexible greatsword can be used to attack in swings or thrusts.
title: Claymore

description:
A very large greatsword. Very heavy, and designed for use with both hands.
Allows for broad attacks that are effective against multiple foes. Requires great strength and experience to handle effectively.
title: Claymore (Dark Souls II)

description:
An unusually large and heavy greatsword normally wielded with two hands.
This highly versatile weapon can be swung broadly or thrusted.
title: Claymore (Dark Souls III)

description: The steel greatshield used by Knight Artorias, who succumbed to the Abyss. Artorias, deeply scarred by the Abyss, used this to form a barrier to protect his compatriot Sif. Although this drained the shield, its magic defense remains high.
title: Cleansing Greatshield

description:
Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.
title: Cleric Armor

description:
Garb worn by a cleric turned undead. Unmistakable vibrant blue robes.
It is said that the blue-robed travelers were entrusted with a duty. They bore large covers on their backs to ensure that they would not become seedbeds for spreading darkness.
title: Cleric Blue Robe

description:
Gauntlets worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
They are rather substantial in size and weight, making their wearer look even bigger than he actually is.
title: Cleric Gauntlets

description:
Gloves worn by a cleric turned undead. Typical attire for blue-robed travelers.
It is said that they were entrusted with a duty, still its nature is yet to be revealed.
title: Cleric Gloves

description:
Hat worn by a cleric turned undead. Typical attire for blue-robed travelers.
It is said that they were entrusted with a duty, still its nature is yet to be revealed.
title: Cleric Hat

description:
Helm worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.
title: Cleric Helm

description:
Leggings worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
They are rather substantial in size and weight, making their wearer look even bigger than he actually is.
title: Cleric Leggings

description:
Trousers worn by a cleric turned undead. Typical attire for blue-robed travelers.
It is said that they were entrusted with a duty, still its nature is yet to be revealed.
title: Cleric Trousers

description:
Candle stick used as both sword and catalyst. Used for worship by the Deacons of the Deep.
The deacons, under the guidance of Archdeacon McDonnell, became both clergymen and sorcerers.
title: Cleric's Candlestick

description:
A parma used by clerics on pilgrimage. Enchanted with a somewhat fragile blessing that allows spells to be deflected by parrying.
Unfortunately, the shield provides very little physical defense, and is more of a lucky charm than a proper shield.
title: Cleric's Parma

description:
Most clerics receive this as their first sacred chime. A catalyst for miracles and hexes.
To use miracles, equip a sacred chime and attune a miracle at a bonfire. The strength of most miracles is affected by the caster's faith.
title: Cleric's Sacred Chime

description:
Sacred chime for casting miracles of the Gods. Chimes such as these are often given to clerics who become Undead.
Equip a talisman or a sacred chime to cast miracles. Miracles must be attuned at a bonfire before use.
title: Cleric's Sacred Chime (Dark Souls III)

description:
A small shield used by clerics on pilgrimage. Enchanted with a somewhat fragile blessing that allows spells to be deflected by parrying.
Specially-crafted to provide extra durability and some level of physical defense.
title: Cleric's Small Shield

description:
This ancient ring, engraved with a large green flower, is of unknown origin.
Hastens the regeneration of stamina.
title: Cloranthy Ring

description:
A simple wooden club. This simple bladeless strike weapon is effective against most foes, is easily handled, and can break the guard of a shield.
However, a single miss makes one wide open, so timing and proximities are crucial.
title: Club

description:
A wooden club.
A primitive weapon, to be certain, but quite powerful, so much so that it can break the guard of a shield.
title: Club (Dark Souls II)

description:
A simple wooden club. Characterized by savage leaping attacks.
This crude bladeless strike weapon is effective against most foes, and can break the guard of a shield.
title: Club (Dark Souls III)

description:
Composite bow emphasizing power. Requires more strength than standard bows.
However, its range is shorter, making it unfit for sniping.
title: Composite Bow

description:
A bow crafted from various materials.
Inflicts more damage than ordinary bows, but has a shorter range, making it unfit for sniping.
title: Composite Bow (Dark Souls II)

description:
Composite short bow emphasizing power. Its size allows for quick shots.
Though more powerful than standard bows, it also requires more strength of the user, and its range is short.
title: Composite Bow (Dark Souls III)

description:
Attire of traveling conjurators.
Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature.
title: Conjurator Boots

description:
Attire of traveling conjurators.
Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature.
title: Conjurator Hood

description:
Attire of traveling conjurators.
Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature.
title: Conjurator Manchettes

description:
Attire of traveling conjurators.
Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature.
title: Conjurator Robe

description:
Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.
In the Great Swamp, it was customary to adorn oneself with articles of nature. Cornyx favored the use of raven feathers.
Ravens are said to have once been Firelink messengers, guiding the undead to the land of ancient gods.
title: Cornyx's Garb

description:
Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.
The long skirt emulates those worn by witches, who were the forebearers of pyromancy.
title: Cornyx's Skirt

description:
Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.
The bronze ornamentation serves to ward off evil spirits.
title: Cornyx's Wrap

description:
Dagger of the unwanted, those guided by heretical storytellers.
A rather large dagger with a powerful attack, but this transparent attempt to intimidate foes reveals much about its owner's fears.
title: Corvian Greatknife

description:
Silk gloves worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.
These figures may have also been oracles.
There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.
title: Court Sorcerer Gloves

description:
Hood worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.
This tall, dark headpiece suggests they may also have been oracles.
There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.
title: Court Sorcerer Hood

description:
Robe worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.
The formal gold stitching suggests they may have also been oracles.
There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.
title: Court Sorcerer Robe

description:
Trousers worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.
These figures may have also been oracles.
There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.
title: Court Sorcerer Trousers

description:
Catalyst used by the court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital. Very powerful when wielded by an exceptionally intelligent sorcerer.
The court sorcerers laid claim to the legacy of the renowned Big Hat Logan, going so far as to emulate him with copies of the staff he used.
title: Court Sorcerer's Staff

description:
This ring symbolizes Knight Artorias' covenant with the beasts of the Abyss.
Its wearer, like Artorias himself, can traverse the abyss.
title: Covenant of Artorias

description:
The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. Its habit of devouring prey even larger than itself has led to an association with gluttony.
This gold ring, engraved with the serpent, boosts its wearer's item discovery, so that more items can be amassed.
title: Covetous Gold Serpent Ring

description:
The serpent is an imperfect dragon and symbol of the Undead. Its habit of devouring prey even larger than itself has led to an association with gluttony.
This silver ring, engraved with the serpent, rewards its wearer with additional souls for each kill.
title: Covetous Silver Serpent Ring

description:
Round wooden shield. Cracked and nearly broken.
Wood shields are lighter than metal shields, but this one has lower physical damage reduction stability, partly due to cracking.
title: Cracked Round Shield

description:
An old smithing hammer.
Looks like a typical hammer, but is in fact incredibly sturdy. Some say it was the hammer used long ago by a famed blacksmith of yore.
title: Craftsman's Hammer

description:
Atypical chain gloves. Belonged to Creighton the Wanderer.
Their design resembles that of the knight order of the eastern land of Mirrah, but with some odd differences that catch the eye.
Perhaps they are a finely-crafted imitation.
title: Creighton's Chain Gloves

description:
Atypical chain leggings. Belonged to Creighton the Wanderer.
Their design resembles that of the knight order of the eastern land of Mirrah, but with some odd differences that catch the eye.
Perhaps they are a finely-crafted imitation.
title: Creighton's Chain Leggings

description:
Atypical chainmail. Belonged to Creighton the Wanderer.
Its design resembles that of the knight order of the eastern land of Mirrah, but with some odd differences that catch the eye.
Perhaps it is a finely-crafted imitation.
title: Creighton's Chainmail

description:
Atypical steel mask. Belonged to Creighton the Wanderer.
Its design resembles that of the knight order of the eastern land of Mirrah, but with some odd differences that catch the eye.
Perhaps it is a finely-crafted imitation.
title: Creighton's Steel Mask

description:
Attire of Creighton the Wanderer, a notorious deserter who fled an order of Mirrah Knights.
Despite the mask's being a symbol of a criminal sentenced to death, Creighton never removed it.
title: Creighton's Steel Mask (Dark Souls III)

description:
Well-used old bronze battle axe with a long hilt and a crescent-shaped blade.
One of the blessed weapons of the Way of White. The Crescent Axe is bequeathed to cleric warriors who have proven their faith.
title: Crescent Axe

description:
A bronze greataxe with a crescent-shaped blade. Its long handle gives the weapon great reach.
One senses that this axe was once imbued with a sacred power, but only traces of it remain.
Perhaps those who blessed this axe are no longer with us.
title: Crescent Axe (Dark Souls II)

description:
A crescent-shaped halberd resembling a long-handled battle axe.
Traditionally wielded by Way of White clerics.
title: Crescent Axe (Dark Souls III)

description:
Ringfinger Leonhard's weapon of choice, a type of shotel imbued with the power of the moon.
Leonhard set out on a journey of rebirth, but decided instead to serve the goddess as a knight, and inherited this weapon.
title: Crescent Moon Sword

description:
A sickle with a crescent-shaped blade.
This sickle, enchanted by magic, is not intended as a weapon, but rather a ceremonial instrument.
title: Crescent Sickle

description:
Shield of a nameless knight, likely a high-ranked knight of Astora.
One of the enchanted blue shields. The Crest Shield greatly reduces magic damage.
title: Crest Shield

description:
A knight's shield engraved with a crest.
One of the enchanted blue shields. The Crest Shield greatly reduces dark damage.
title: Crest Shield (Dark Souls III)

description:
Gloves of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.
The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that.
title: Crimson Gloves

description:
A standard wooden parma.
The fancy name and nifty paint are surely a merchant's efforts to make this very ordinary shield more attractive.
title: Crimson Parma

description:
Standard round wooden shield. It is daubed with a red paint that symbolizes the blood of warriors.
Wooden shields are light, manageable, and offer relatively high magic absorption.
title: Crimson Parma (Dark Souls III)

description:
Robe of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths and the Four Kings who descended into Dark.
The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that.
title: Crimson Robe

description:
Waistcloth of the sorcerers who flooded New Londo to seal away the Darkwraiths, and the Four Kings who descended into dark.
The Sealers were once known as healers, and the bright crimson was a symbol of that.
title: Crimson Waistcloth

description:
Thrusting sword wielded by Corvian Knights, and a special paired weapon. When twin-handed, brandish four thin-edge blades in the left hand.
In their infatuation with Sister Friede, the Corvian Knights swore to protect the painting from fire, and to this end, took to the execution of their own brethren.
title: Crow Quills

description:
Talons used by Corvian Knights. Inflicts five perpendicular slashes, causing heavy bleeding.
In their infatuation with Sister Friede, the Corvian Knights swore to protect the painting from fire and to this end, too to the execution of their own brethren.
title: Crow Talons

description:
Special magic crown bestowed upon Dusk, Princess of Oolacile, upon her birth.
Its wearer is blessed by all manner of magic. This raises the power and effect of the wearer's magic, but damage suffered by magic attack also rises.
title: Crown of Dusk

description:
Feathered crown bestowed upon the princess of Oolacile, land of ancient golden sorceries.
Through the guardian Elizabeth's blessing, this raises the power and effect of the wearer's magic, but damage suffered by magic attacks rises in tandem.
title: Crown of Dusk (Dark Souls III)

description:
Crown of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
This crown of the gods demands faith immeasurable of its wearer, but it is imbued with Darkmoon power that enhances all magic. The image of the sun manifests Gwyndolin's deep adoration of the sun.
title: Crown of the Dark Sun

description:
Crown of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his great clan before linking the flame. But he did keep his crown, perhaps to preserve a symbol of the monarch, for its actual power had fully subsided.
title: Crown of the Great Lord

description:
Crown of the Ivory King who once ruled this land.
Far to the north, a King built a great cathedral to appease the raging flame. But when he sensed the degradation of his soul, he left without a word, leaving everything to Alsanna, who had, unbeknownst, found a place at his side.
But these were events of long ago, and today, no one even remembers the King's name.
title: Crown of the Ivory King (helm)

description:
Crown of the Old Iron King who once ruled this land.
The King sunk below the scorching iron, met the one whose name must never be repeated, and became Ichorous Earth.
But these were events of long ago, and today, no one even remembers the King's name.
title: Crown of the Old Iron King (helm)

description:
Crown of the Sunken King who once ruled this land.
The King erected the Eternal Sanctum below the earth to worship the great dragon, but the towering bulwark crumbled with the city shortly after the dragon's awakening.
But these were events of long ago, and today, no one even remembers the King's name.
title: Crown of the Sunken King (helm)

description:
A cross spear hung with a malformed corpse.
Once, a mad king was born to the pygmy royalty and Shira, knight of Filianore, put him to rest. But Shira's cross spear, unable to kill the undying king, only pinned itself to him. Shira delivered them together to the darkroom, where she stayed and held them close.
title: Crucifix of the Mad King

description: Ultra greatsword symbolizing guardianship over the Undead Crypt. The sword has never seen the light of day, and is steeped in dark.
title: Crypt Blacksword

description:
A sacred chime, once the possession of Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, and defiled by the scholars of the Grand Archives.
The power of crystals granted the scholars a degree of success. In this case, their work enabled this chime to be suitable for casting both miracles and sorceries.
title: Crystal Chime

description:
A fully crystallized straight sword. How such a weapon was created is entirely unknown.
The crystallization boosts its attack, but makes the blade brittle. The sword cannot be used for long, as it cannot be repaired.
title: Crystal Greatsword

description:
Weapon born from the mystical creature of the Darkroot Garden, the Moonlight Butterfly.
Imbued with a powerful crystal power, like the butterfly created by Seath the Scaleless. Can emit crystal light rings.
title: Crystal Ring Shield

description:
Thrusting sword with tiny crystals scattered across its blade, used by the Crystal Sages for self-defense.
The crystals boost the magic damage inflicted by the sword, and the item discovery of its wielder, fruits of the lifetime of research conducted by the sages.
title: Crystal Sage's Rapier

description:
A fully crystallized straight shield. How such a weapon was created is entirely unknown.
The crystallization boosts its defense, but makes the shield brittle. The shield cannot be used for long, as it cannot be repaired.
title: Crystal Shield

description:
A fully crystallized straight sword. How such a weapon was created is entirely unknown.
The crystallization boosts its attack, but makes the blade brittle. The sword cannot be used for long, as it cannot be repaired.
title: Crystal Straight Sword

description:
Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.
title: Crystalline Armor

description:
Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.
title: Crystalline Gauntlets

description:
Helm worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal power provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.
title: Crystalline Helm

description:
Leggings worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal power provides good defense, but they cannot be used for long because they are easily broken and cannot be repaired.
title: Crystalline Leggings

description:
Greatshield given to those who resisted the curse long ago.
Far too heavy for an ordinary person, perhaps it signifies the foolishness of resisting the curse.
And yet, those who bear the weight of this shield will not find its protections against curses wanting.
title: Curse Ward Greatshield

description:
One of the infamous bite rings commissioned by Sir Arstor of Carim.
Despite the dreadful rumors surrounding its creation, this ring is an unmistakable asset, in its ability to help prevent curses.
title: Cursebite Ring

description:
Small shield used by Aldian warlocks. Reinforced by a covert ritual that granted the shield the power of flame. Can deflect spells by parrying.
The peculiar figure known as Lord Aldia kept Giants in his manor, and attempted to recreate a dragon, but after some time, was not heard from again.
title: Cursed Bone Shield

description:
A curved greatsword forged from the soul of the Ancient Dragon.
In the Age of the Ancients, the world was unformed, shrouded by fog. A land of grey crags, archtrees, and everlasting dragons.
title: Curved Dragon Greatsword

description:
A great curved sword with an ominous blade. One of the forbidden weapons sealed away by the Ivory King.
Formed by rock, tree, and the remnants of a most peculiar soul.
It is said that the farther its wielder travels, the deadlier the blade becomes.
title: Curved Nil Greatsword

description:
A twinblade imported from a foreign land.
The razor-sharp blades cause bleeding, but as a result, are easily worn and dulled.
When wielded by a master, this dual-tipped blade is an unparalleled weapon that hardly allows a foe the opportunity to retaliate.
title: Curved Twinblade

description:
This standard small dagger has only a modest attack but can be jabbed in rapid succession, and is effective in critical hits such as after a parry or when stabbing in the back.
With both slash and thrust attacks this dagger is useful in various situations.
title: Dagger

description:
A standard dagger.
Has only modest attack and short reach, but can be jabbed in rapid succession.
With a powerful critical attack, this is a potent weapon in the hands of the capable.
title: Dagger (Dark Souls II)

description:
Standard small dagger.
Small daggers lack power or reach, but can deal quick consecutive hits due to their light weight. Highly effective when used for critical hits, such as after parrying or attacking from behind.
title: Dagger (Dark Souls III)

description:
Armor worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.
The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her armor fusing with her own hide.
title: Dancer's Armor

description:
Crown worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.
The mirage-like aurora veil is said to be an article of the old gods, permitted only for direct descendants of the old royal family.
title: Dancer's Crown

description: Paired enchanted swords that Pontiff Sulyvahn bestowed upon the Dancer of the Boreal Valley. These blades, symbolic of the Dancer's vows, are enchanted with dark magic in the right-hand, and fire in the left, mirroring the Pontiff.
title: Dancer's Enchanted Swords

description:
Gauntlets worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.
The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her armor fusing with her own hide.
title: Dancer's Gauntlets

description:
Leggings worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.
The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her armor fusing with her own hide.
title: Dancer's Leggings

description:
Armor of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Their armor transformed, and remains a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.
title: Dark Armor

description:
Armor of a knight subsumed by dark.
No one knows the true identity of these men who are said to freely manipulate the dark. Old foreign legends describe them as poor souls who chased the lost art of lifedrain.
title: Dark Armor (Dark Souls II)

description:
Armor of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Looks as if it may crumble to dust at any moment.
The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.
title: Dark Armor (Dark Souls III)

description:
Gauntlets of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Their gauntlets transformed, and remain symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.
title: Dark Gauntlets

description:
Gauntlets of a knight subsumed by dark.
No one knows the true identity of these men who are said to freely manipulate the dark. Old foreign legends describe them as poor souls who chased the lost art of lifedrain.
title: Dark Gauntlets (Dark Souls II)

description:
Gauntlets of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Look as if they may crumble to dust at any moment.
The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.
title: Dark Gauntlets (Dark Souls III)

description: The Darkwraiths, incited by Kaathe, use the power of the dark soul to absorb humanity, an art shared by this weapon, which also acts as a special shield. The ancients, particularly, could sap the humanity of even a replete saint in the blink of an eye.
title: Dark Hand

description:
Weapon that allows its wielder to evoke an art unique to Londor, the land of the Hollow. It is also said to be an ancient relic of a Primordial Serpent.
The Dark Hand mercilessly saps the essence of its victims, and can also double as a special shield. Cannot be used two-handed.
title: Dark Hand (Dark Souls III)

description:
Leggings of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Their leggings transformed, and remain a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.
title: Dark Leggings

description:
Leggings of a knight subsumed by dark.
No one knows the true identity of these men who are said to freely manipulate the dark. Old foreign legends describe them as poor souls who chased the lost art of lifedrain.
title: Dark Leggings (Dark Souls II)

description:
Leggings of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Look as if they may crumble to dust at any moment.
The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.
title: Dark Leggings (Dark Souls III)

description:
Mask of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Some say the skeletal mask of an ancient Darkwraith is partially fused with the flesh of its face.
title: Dark Mask

description:
Mask of a knight subsumed by dark.
No one knows the true identity of these men who are said to freely manipulate the dark. Old foreign legends describe them as poor souls who chased the lost art of lifedrain.
title: Dark Mask (Dark Souls II)

description:
Bone mask of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Looks as if it may crumble to dust at any moment.
The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.
title: Dark Mask (Dark Souls III)

description:
A flame catalyst used by pyromancers.
Pyromancers rouse this flame to produce various flame arts. The flame rewards those with a thirst for power. The more Hollowed one is, the stronger its effect is.
title: Dark Pyromancy Flame

description:
A dark silver dagger used by the Lord's Blade Ciaran, of Gwyn's Four Knights.
The victim is first distracted by dazzling streaks of the Gold Tracer, then stung by the vicious poison of this dagger.
title: Dark Silver Tracer

description:
Pitch-black straight sword of the Darkwraith, survivor of the land swallowed by darkness.
The Darkwraiths were the first red orb invaders, and originators of a unique sword technique inspired by their thick, broad blades.
title: Dark Sword

description:
This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface.
Agents of subterfuge in this faraway land are particularly fond of the dark gold wood grain, which greatly alters the player's rolling motion.
title: Dark Wood Grain Ring

description:
Katana of Grave Warden Agdayne. Has a crystal-clear blade and a strong attack that slices through enemy shields.
This katana was originally wielded by the one who gave us the first death, and still exists imperfectly between planes.
title: Darkdrift

description:
A cursed sword with an unseen blade, the choice weapon for Yuria of Londor.
Yuria, a mentor of the Sable Church and accomplished swordswoman, is said to have claimed a hundred lives with this weapon.
title: Darkdrift (Dark Souls III)

description:
Ring granted to those bound by the Darkmoon Blade Covenant. Answer Dark Sun Gwyndolin's summoning.
Gwyndolin, all too aware of his repulsive, frail appearance, created the illusion of a sister Gwynevere, who helps him guard over Anor Londo. An unmasking of these deities would be tantamount to blasphemy.
title: Darkmoon Blade Covenant Ring

description:
Bow born from the soul of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity who watches over the abandoned city of Gods, Anor Londo.
This golden bow is imbued with powerful magic and is most impressive with Moonlight Arrows.
title: Darkmoon Bow

description:
Longbow of Darkmoon Gwyndolin. who was gradually devoured by Aldrich.
This golden bow is imbued with powerful magic and is most impressive with Moonlight Arrows.
title: Darkmoon Longbow

description:
This ring is granted to adherents of Gwyndolin, Darkmoon deity and last born of Gwyn, Lord of Sunlight. Grants additional magic and attunement slots.
The Dark Sun Gwyndolin is the only remaining deity in Anor Londo. His followers are few, but their tasks are of vital importance.
title: Darkmoon Seance Ring

description: Medium for casting miracles of the Gods. Granted to Darkmoon Blade knights, adherents to the Covenant of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin. This talisman demands dutiful faith from its owner, but has very high miracle adjustment.
title: Darkmoon Talisman

description:
The sword of the knights of the Four Kings of New Londo. Its blade is wide and thick, and it is wielded in an unusual manner.
When the Four Kings were seduced by evil, their knights became Darkwraiths, servants of the Dark who wielded these darkswords.
title: Darksword

description:
Robe worn by deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep. The deep red pigment denotes the blessing of fire.
In time, those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power. It seems that neither tending to the flame, nor the faith, could save them.
title: Deacon Robe

description:
Skirt worn by deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep, worn on the inside of the deep red robe.
In time, those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power. It seems that neither tending to the flame, nor the faith, could save them.
title: Deacon Skirt

description:
Greatsword wielded by the Throne Defender. Unleash its true power to enwreath in magic.
The Defender has stood by the throne for ages. Will his wait be worth the while?
title: Defender Greatsword

description:
Shield of the Throne Defender. Permeated by powerful magic.
The Defender has stood by the throne for ages. Will his wait be worth the while?
title: Defender's Shield

description:
The lesser Capra demons use these greatswords in pairs. The blade is cast iron and hooked.
The sword is imbued with no particular magic, but for those who have the strength, its great weight will smash foes mercilessly.
title: Demon Great Machete

description: Demon catalyst formed from Izalith molten rock. Can be used as fire weapon. The Demon Firesage was the first demon, and the last master of the original fire arts before the Witch of Izalith was engulfed by Chaos, creating pyromancy.
title: Demon's Catalyst

description:
A demonic fist that burns with fiery essence. Its wielder can release this power through use of its Skill.
When two-handed, fists are equipped in each hand.
title: Demon's Fist

description:
Demon weapon built from the stone archtrees. Used by lesser demons at North Undead Asylum.
This hammer is imbued with no special power, but can merrily beat foes to a pulp, providing you have the strength to wield it.
title: Demon's Great Hammer

description:
Great hammer made of unknown materials. Perhaps it is stone, or even wood.
The origins of its name are unclear. Its tremendous weight suggests that it was never intended for humans. Perhaps it was an offering to the demons that appear in legend.
title: Demon's Great Hammer (Dark Souls II)

description:
Carved from the bones of fellow demons. Wielded by the lesser Taurus demons.
This axe is imbued with no special power, but can merrily beat foes to a pulp, providing you have the strength to wield it.
title: Demon's Greataxe

description:
This greataxe, a favorite among demons, contains the strength of fire.
The demons, born of Chaos, harbor fire, and yet they are twisted and malformed, such that they were never meant to be.
title: Demon's Greataxe (Dark Souls III)

description:
This chaotic thing, the last flame kindled by the demon prince, is shaped like the claw marks of a demon.
It is both a fiery bladed weapon and pyromancy flame.
title: Demon's Scar

description:
Carved from the bones of fellow demons. Wielded by the slim lesser Batwing demons.
The weapon of these chaos demons wandering Anor Londo are different from those of other chaos demons, and are imbued with lightning.
title: Demon's Spear

description:
Garb of the desert pyromancers, who once walked the halls of the Earthen Peak. It is said that the thin burgundy cloth breathes with magic.
Desert pyromancers, most of them female, were known for their great fans of flame, and enchanting looks.
But what is enchanting can also be deadly, especially when clothed in such alluring garb.
title: Desert Pyromancer Garb

description:
Gloves of the desert pyromancers, who once walked the halls of the Earthen Peak. It is said that the thin burgundy cloth breathes with magic.
Desert pyromancers, most of them female, were known for their great fans of flame, and enchanting looks.
But what is enchanting can also be deadly, especially when clothed in such alluring garb.
title: Desert Pyromancer Gloves

description:
Hood of the desert pyromancers, who once walked the halls of the Earthen Peak. It is said that the thin, burgundy cloth breathes with magic.
Desert pyromancers, most of them female, were known for their great fans of flame, and enchanting looks.
But what is enchanting can also be deadly, especially when clothed in such alluring garb.
title: Desert Pyromancer Hood

description:
Skirt of the desert pyromancers, who once walked the halls of the Earthen Peak. It is said that the thin burgundy cloth breathes with magic.
Desert pyromancers, most of them female, were known for their great fans of flame, and enchanting looks.
But what is enchanting can also be deadly, especially when clothed in such alluring garb.
title: Desert Pyromancer Skirt

description:
Sorceress gloves from the distant land of Jugo. Appears to be a plain, thin fabric, but is permeated with powerful magic.
Desert Sorceresses have enchanting looks, and they use them to catch people off guard.
Oddly enough, even those who are perceptive enough to realize the ploy fall prey to their seductions with alarming regularity.
title: Desert Sorceress Gloves

description:
Sorceress hood from the distant land of Jugo. Appears to be a plain, thin fabric, but is permeated with powerful magic.
Desert Sorceresses have enchanting looks, and they use them to catch people off guard.
Oddly enough, even those who are perceptive enough to realize the ploy fall prey to their seductions with alarming regularity.
title: Desert Sorceress Hood

description:
Sorceress skirt from the distant land of Jugo. Appears to be a plain, thin fabric, but is permeated with powerful magic.
Desert Sorceresses have enchanting looks, and they use them to catch people off guard.
Oddly enough, even those who are perceptive enough to realize the ploy fall prey to their seductions with alarming regularity.
title: Desert Sorceress Skirt

description:
Sorceress top from the distant land of Jugo. Appears to be a plain, thin fabric, but is permeated with powerful magic.
Desert Sorceresses have enchanting looks, and they use them to catch people off guard.
Oddly enough, even those who are perceptive enough to realize the ploy fall prey to their seductions with alarming regularity.
title: Desert Sorceress Top

description:
Common soldier's armor. Its insignia is worn beyond recognition.
This musty, rusted hunk of metal befits one reduced to thievery.
title: Deserter Armor

description:
Common soldier's trousers.
This musty, rusted hunk of metal befits one reduced to thievery.
title: Deserter Trousers

description:
Unassuming dingy cuffs.
Although by now gray with soot and nearly unraveled, their fabric was originally a pure white.
title: Dingy Cuffs

description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
They are thought to have once been the white gloves of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened them over the years.
title: Dingy Gloves

description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
It is thought to have once been the white hood of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened it over the years.
title: Dingy Hood

description:
An unassuming dingy hood.
Although by now gray with soot and nearly unraveled, its fabric was originally a pure white.
title: Dingy Hood (Dark Souls II)

description:
Worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
It is thought to have once been the white robe of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires darkened it over the years.
title: Dingy Robe

description:
An unassuming dingy robe.
Although by now gray with soot and nearly unraveled, its fabric was originally a pure white.
title: Dingy Robe (Dark Souls II)

description:
A rare sacred chime of unknown origin. Can be used as a shield.
This chime, likely brought here by a visiting saint, slightly augments the effects of miracles. Use strong attack to emit miracles and hexes.
title: Disc Chime

description:
Boots worn by acolytes of Aldia.
Several of the greatest minds converged in Aldia to weave strange new rituals, but rumors suggest that during the course of their work their thoughts were not their own.
These practical boots are designed to prevent the acolyte from slipping on the blood of the sacrifice.
title: Dragon Acolyte Boots

description:
Gloves worn by acolytes of Aldia.
Several of the greatest minds converged in Aldia to weave strange new rituals, but rumors suggest that during the course of their work their thoughts were not their own.
These white gloves are designed to bear the brunt of the ritual sacrifice's gushing blood.
title: Dragon Acolyte Gloves

description:
Mask worn by acolytes of Aldia.
Several of the greatest minds converged in Aldia to weave strange new rituals, but rumors suggest that during he course of their work their thoughts were not their own.
The nebulous face of the mask is designed to deflect the ire of the ritual sacrifice.
title: Dragon Acolyte Mask

description:
Robe worn by acolytes of Aldia.
Several of the greatest minds converged in Aldia to weave strange new rituals, but rumors suggest that during the course of their work their thoughts were not their own.
This white robe is designed to bear the brunt of the ritual sacrifice's gushing blood.
title: Dragon Acolyte Robe

description:
A weapon from the soul of the Iron Golem, guardian of Sen's Fortress who repelled countless heroes who sought Anor Londo.
The Gods fused the power of the soul with the great bones of the dragons, forming an appropriate core for the giant golem.
title: Dragon Bone Fist

description:
A sacred chime shaped as a dragon. A catalyst for miracles and hexes.
This chime sat long in the Dark Chasm, but still one senses a sublime purity. Only those with the deepest faith can wield this chime, but they will be rewarded with greatly amplified spells.
title: Dragon Chime

description:
Shield of a nameless knight, likely a high-ranked knight of Astora.
One of the enchanted blue shields. The dragon crest shield greatly reduces fire damage.
title: Dragon Crest Shield

description:
A knight's shield engraved with a crest depicting a dragon.
One of the enchanted blue shields. The Dragon Crest Shield greatly reduces fire damage.
title: Dragon Crest Shield (Dark Souls III)

description:
This sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, came from the tail of the stone dragon of Ash Lake, descendant of the ancient dragons.
Its great mystical power will be unleashed when wielded with two hands.
title: Dragon Greatsword

description:
This axe, one of the rare dragon weapons, is formed by the tail of the Gaping Dragon, a distant, deformed descendant of the everlasting dragons.
The axe is imbued with a mystical power, to be released when held with both hands.
title: Dragon King Greataxe

description:
Mask worn by the Archmaster of Aldia.
Several of the greatest minds converged in Aldia to weave strange new rituals, but rumors suggest that during the course of their work their thoughts were not their own.
The nebulous face of the mask is designed to deflect the ire of the ritual sacrifice.
title: Dragon Sage Hood

description:
Created from an everlasting dragon tooth. Legendary great hammer of Havel the Rock.
The dragon tooth will never break as it is harder than stone, and it grants its wielder resistance to magic and flame.
title: Dragon Tooth

description:
A giant dragon tooth used as a great hammer. As solid as a boulder, this tooth is said to be taken from a dragon, but the truth of this claim is unclear.
What is certain is that it bears some mystical power, and its wielder gains resistance to magic and fire.
title: Dragon Tooth (Dark Souls II)

description:
Created from an everlasting dragon tooth that will never break.
Left by Havel himself, along with his boulder-like great shield. Grants its wielder resistance to magic and fire.
title: Dragon Tooth (Dark Souls III)

description:
This shield, as hard as a great boulder, is formed by the head of the descendant of an Archdragon.
The Ringed Knights, by command of the gods, stood amongst the ranks who set out to slay the dragons, but their contributions were never lauded.
title: Dragonhead Greatshield

description:
This shield, as hard as a great boulder, is formed by the head of the descendant of an Archdragon.
The Ringed Knights, by command of the gods, stood amongst the ranks who set out to slay the dragons, but their contributions were never lauded.
title: Dragonhead Shield

description:
Armor worn by the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. According to legend, the Dragonriders straddled not horses, but wyrms.
Aspiring Dragonriders who had not the mettle to handle their training were torn apart by the wyrms, and those who survived emerged with deific strength.
title: Dragonrider Armor

description:
Dragonrider Bow
Bow wielded by the dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. Merely drawing this bow requires inhuman strength, but each shot has deadly potential.
Demands great skill of its wielder, and thus served to test the worthiness of those who aspired to join the Dragonriders.
title: Dragonrider Bow

description:
Longbow of the Dragonriders, who served the Old King of Want.
The Dragonriders were the Old King's royal guard, and great strength was demanded of them. Merely drawing this bow calls for inhuman strength. The worthy few who can master this bow, however, use it to devastating effect.
title: Dragonrider Bow (Dark Souls III)

description:
Gauntlets worn by the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. According to legend, the Dragonriders straddled not horses, but wyrms.
Aspiring Dragonriders who had not the mettle to handle their training were torn apart by the wyrms, and those who survived emerged with deific strength.
title: Dragonrider Gauntlets

description:
Greatshield of the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard.
The rank of Dragonrider was reserved for honorable warriors who helped found Drangleic. Together with the King, they crushed its former inhabitants and erected a magnificent kingdom upon their graves.
title: Dragonrider Greatshield

description:
Helm worn by the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard.According to legend, the Dragonriders straddled not horses, but wyrms.
Aspiring Dragonriders who had not the mettle to handle their training were torn apart by their wyrms, and those who survived emerged with deific strength.
title: Dragonrider Helm

description:
Leggings worn by the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. According to legend, the Dragonriders straddled not horses, but wyrms.
Aspiring Dragonriders who had not the mettle to handle their training were torn apart by their wyrms, and those who survived emerged with deific strength.
title: Dragonrider Leggings

description:
Twinblade of the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. Twinblades are wielded with an unusual technique.
This one strikes hard but is very heavy. Demands great skill of it's wielder, and thus served to test the worthiness of those who aspired to join the Dragonriders.
title: Dragonrider Twinblade

description:
Halberd of the Dragonriders, King Vendrick's royal guard. A highly versatile weapon that can slash, sweep, and thrust when wielded nimbly, and is also imbued with magic.
Demands great skill of its wielder, and thus served to test the worthiness of those who aspire to join the Dragonriders.
title: Dragonrider's Halberd

description:
Dragonscale armor of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons.
Dragon scales are razor-sharp and cannot be burned.
title: Dragonscale Armor

description:
Dragonscale waistcloth of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons.
Dragon scales are razor-sharp and cannot be burned.
title: Dragonscale Waistcloth

description:
Golden lion armor associated with Dragonslayer Ornstein, from the age of gods, and imbued with the strength of lightning.
In the dragonless age, this knight, who long guarded the ruined cathedral, left the land in search of the nameless king.
title: Dragonslayer Armor

description:
Golden lion gauntlets associated with Dragonslayer Ornstein, from the age of gods, and imbued with the strength of lightning.
In the dragonless age, this knight, who long guarded the ruined cathedral, left the land in search of the nameless king.
title: Dragonslayer Gauntlets

description:
Melted iron greataxe that once formed part of the Dragonslayer Armour.
Thickly imbued with the power of lightning. Use skill to draw upon the techniques used to slay the archdragons.
title: Dragonslayer Greataxe

description:
Bow of the Dragonslayers, led by Hawkeye Gough, one of Gwyn's Four Knights.
This bow's unusual size requires that it be anchored to the ground when fired. Only uses specialized great arrows.
title: Dragonslayer Greatbow

description:
A greatbow said to be used to down ancient dragons flying high above the clouds. Extremely large for a mere bow, and more destructive than any ranged weapon imaginable.
Shooting this bow first requires the grounding of its stabilizing anchor, which takes time and leaves the shooter vulnerable. Also requires greatarrows.
title: Dragonslayer Greatbow (Dark Souls II)

description:
Greatbow used by the Dragonslayers during the age of gods. Far greater in size than any normal bow, and far more devastating.
The bow must be anchored to the ground when fired, a time-consuming operation that leaves the user vulnerable. Only specialized great arrows can be fired from the bow.
title: Dragonslayer Greatbow (Dark Souls III)

description:
Melted iron shield that once formed part of the Dragonslayer Armour.
The shield offers high protection to lightning, which the Dragonslayer commanded as his own, and its Skill has faint echoes of the Dragonslayer's own fighting style.
title: Dragonslayer Greatshield

description:
Golden lion helm associated with Dragonslayer Ornstein, from the age of gods, and imbued with the strength of lightning.
In the dragonless age, this knight, who long guarded the ruined cathedral, left the land in search of the nameless king.
title: Dragonslayer Helm

description:
Golden lion leggings associated with Dragonslayer Ornstein, from the age of gods, and imbued with the strength of lightning.
In the dragonless age, this knight, who long guarded the ruined cathedral, left the land in search of the nameless king.
title: Dragonslayer Leggings

description: Cross spear born from the soul of Ornstein, a Dragonslayer guarding Anor Londo cathedral. Inflicts lightning damage; effective against dragons. Two-handed thrust relies on cross and buries spear deep within a dragon's hide, and sends human foes flying.
title: Dragonslayer Spear

description:
A ranseur forged from the soul of the Old Dragonslayer.
The spear of the knight known as the Dragonslayer was imbued with the power of lightning, and shattered the stone scales of dragons. Strong attack unleashes its latent power.
title: Dragonslayer Spear (Dark Souls II)

description:
Cross spear associated with Ornstein the Dragonslayer. A weapon of the gods imbued with the strength of lightning.
Two-handed thrust utilizes the support of the cross and requires great might, but can pierce deep into the flesh of dragons, and send mere men flying.
title: Dragonslayer Spear (Dark Souls III)

description:
A dragon hunting weapon from the age of the gods. The earliest form of the cross spear, serving as both sword and spear.
Its owner was the Nameless King and deific hunter of dragons. The swordspear is imbued with lightning, of which he was the heir.
title: Dragonslayer Swordspear

description:
Axe favored by Creighton the Wanderer, infamous deserter of the Knights of Mirrah.
Called Dragonslayer's Axe for the lightning that pulsates within its blade, but Creighton used it to slay men.
title: Dragonslayer's Axe

description:
The beloved black axe of the gallant Shieldless Lothian, formerly of Forossa.
No warrior matched the ferocity of unbeatable Lothian, but he abruptly retired from the battlefield and was never heard from again. Some say that he grew tired of the frailty of human foes, and set off to slay the legendary dragon.
title: Dragonslayer's Crescent Axe

description:
This Sword, one of the rare dragon weapons, is formed by a drake's tail. Drakes are seen as undeveloped imitators of the dragons, but they are likely their distant kin.
The sword is imbued with a mystical power, to be released when held with both hands.
title: Drake Sword

description:
Armor of the Black Drakeblood Knights, who came from a land long forgotten.
The Drakeblood Knights, who worshiped the blood of dragons, were led by Sir Yorgh in a siege of the Eternal Sanctum, but sunk into the Sanctum when the sleeping dragon awoke.
The red cloth wrapped around their black armor represents the sacred blood of dragons.
title: Drakeblood Armor

description:
Armor of the Drakeblood Knights, worshippers of the blood of dragons. The red cloth is said to symbolize their yearning for blood.
Dragon worship has captured the hearts and minds of warriors across the lands for many ages. Perhaps such warriors are attracted to doctrines of few words.
title: Drakeblood Armor (Dark Souls III)

description:
Gauntlets of the Black Drakeblood Knights, who came from a land long forgotten.
The Drakeblood Knights, who worshiped the blood of dragons, were led by Sir Yorgh in a siege of the Eternal Sanctum, but sunk into the Sanctum when the sleeping dragon awoke.
The red cloth wrapped around their black armor represents the sacred blood of dragons.
title: Drakeblood Gauntlets

description:
Armor of the Drakeblood Knights, worshippers of the blood of dragons. The red cloth is said to symbolize their yearning for blood.
Dragon worship has captured the hearts and minds of warriors across the lands for many ages. Perhaps such warriors are attracted to doctrines of few words.
title: Drakeblood Gauntlets (Dark Souls III)

description:
Greatsword wielded by the Drakeblood Knights, led by the honorable Sir Yorgh. The insignia chiseled upon its hilt symbolizes dragon's blood.
To the Drakeblood Knights, fresh dragon blood was sacrosanct. They believed that by obtaining it, they could achieve a true understanding of life, transcending their own banal existence.
title: Drakeblood Greatsword

description:
Greatsword wielded by an order of knights who venerate dragon blood.
This sword, its blade engraved with script symbolizing dragon blood, inflicts magic and lightning damage.
title: Drakeblood Greatsword (Dark Souls III)

description:
Helm of the Black Drakeblood Knights, who came from a land long forgotten.
The Drakeblood Knights, who worshiped the blood of dragons, were led by Sir Yorgh in a siege of the Eternal Sanctum, but sunk into the Sanctum when the sleeping dragon awoke.
The red cloth wrapped around their black armor represents the sacred blood of dragons.
title: Drakeblood Helm

description:
Armor of the Drakeblood Knights, worshippers of the blood of dragons. The red cloth is said to symbolize their yearning for blood.
Dragon worship has captured the hearts and minds of warriors across the lands for many ages. Perhaps such warriors are attracted to doctrines of few words.
title: Drakeblood Helm (Dark Souls III)

description:
Leggings of the Black Drakeblood Knights, who came from a land long forgotten.
The Drakeblood Knights, who worshiped the blood of dragons, were led by Sir Yorgh in a siege of the Eternal Sanctum, but sunk into the Sanctum when the sleeping dragon awoke.
The red cloth wrapped around their black armor represents the sacred blood of dragons.
title: Drakeblood Leggings

description:
Armor of the Drakeblood Knights, worshippers of the blood of dragons. The red cloth is said to symbolize their yearning for blood.
Dragon worship has captured the hearts and minds of warriors across the lands for many ages. Perhaps such warriors are attracted to doctrines of few words.
title: Drakeblood Leggings (Dark Souls III)

description:
Giant onyx armor.
Something dark indeed eats away at the drakekeepers, eternal guardians of the shrine.
title: Drakekeeper Armor

description:
Giant onyx leggings.
Something dark indeed eats away at the drakekeepers, eternal guardians of the shrine.
title: Drakekeeper Boots

description:
Giant onyx gauntlets.
Something dark indeed eats away at the drakekeepers, eternal guardians of the shrine.
title: Drakekeeper Gauntlets

description:
Giant onyx helmet.
Something dark indeed eats away at the drakekeepers, eternal guardians of the shrine.
title: Drakekeeper Helm

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black great hammer.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Great Hammer

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black greataxe.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Greataxe

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black greatshield.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Greatshield

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black greatshield.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Shield

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black straight sword.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Sword

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black greatsword.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Ultra Greatsword

description:
An extremely sturdy pitch-black war hammer.
Colossal warriors staunchly watch over the shrine, ready to defend its resident, or allow one worthy enough to be granted audience.
title: Drakekeeper's Warpick

description:
A sword decorated with drake wings. Use strong attack to unleash its latent power.
The blade of this sword is split into two, and is best swung in smashing motions rather than slices.
Drakes are likely descendants of the ancient dragons, and although their strength pales in comparison to the what is described in legend, to mere humans they are still mighty beasts.
title: Drakewing Ultra Greatsword

description:
Armor of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendants of the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire.
Fine protection that is both light and strong, having been reinforced with rare geisteel.
The Drang Knights were once feared sellswords, until treason meant descending into the abyss, and they were separated forever.
title: Drang Armor

description:
Gauntlets of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendants of the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire.
Fine protection that is both light and strong, having been reinforced with rare geisteel.
The Drang Knights were once feared sellswords, until treason meant descending into the abyss, and they were separated forever.
title: Drang Gauntlets

description: Paired hammers of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendants from the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire. When the Drang Knights disbanded, they scattered across the lands as sellswords. They quickly became known for shieldless, aggressive tactics that struck fear into the hearts of men.
title: Drang Hammers

description:
Shoes of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendants of the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire.
Fine protection that is both light and strong, having been reinforced with rare geisteel.
The Drang knights were once feared sellswords, until treason meant descending into the abyss, and they were separated forever.
title: Drang Shoes

description: Paired spears of the Drang Knights, proclaimed descendants from the land known for the legend of the Linking of the Fire. When the Drang Knights disbanded, they scattered across the lands as sellswords. They quickly became known for shieldless, aggressive tactics that struck fear into the hearts of men.
title: Drang Twinspears

description:
Traditional Drangleic gauntlets. Belonged to Captain Drummond.
Drummond's ancestrs have served Drangleic for generations, principally as defenders of the great fort, but Captain Drummond is the last in this proud line.
title: Drangleic Gauntlets

description:
A traditional Drangleic Helmet. Belonged to Captain Drummond.
In his day, King Vendrick was fair and just, and expected the same of his liegemen.
This helm was proof of King Vendrick's trust, an honor, until his transfiguration.
title: Drangleic Helm

description:
Traditional Drangleic Leggings. Belonged to Captain Drummond.
Drummond's ancestors have served Drangleic for generations, principally as defenders of the great fort, but Captain Drummond is the last in this proud line.
title: Drangleic Leggings

description:
Traditional Drangleic armor. Belonged to Captain Drummond.
Drummond's ancestors have served Drangleic for generations, principally as defenders of the great fort, but Captain Drummond is the last in this proud line.
title: Drangleic Mail

description:
Captain Drummond's shield. Even with its embossing terribly worn, this shield exudes pride and authority.
An heirloom passed from grandfather to father, and then from father to son. Drummond, and those before him, held this shield when facing those who would threaten their great land.
title: Drangleic Shield

description:
Greatsword of Drummond, Royal Army Captain. An old and unadorned sword, perhaps, but the pride and joy of this venerable captain.
An heirloom passed from grandfather to father, and then from father to son. Drummond, and those before him, used this sword to repel those who would threaten their great land.
title: Drangleic Sword

description:
Monocled hat favored by Blue-eyed Durgo. Extends arrow range.
The hero Durgo, an expert bowman, and his brother-in-law defended their homeland from aggressors. In spite of Lanafir's policy of isolationism, Durgo was well known even beyond its domain.
title: Durgo's Hat

description:
This magic crown-shaped ring was granted to Princess Dusk of Oolacile upon her birth.
The ringstone allows its wearer to cast additional sorceries, but at the cost of one-half of HP.
title: Dusk Crown Ring

description:
Greatshield with an eagle design. Lightest and easiest greatshield to handle.
Greatshields are very stable, and deflect attacks. But one cannot parry, and instead bashes with the shield.
title: Eagle Shield

description:
This large twin-bladed axe forged with bronze is a ceremonial weapon normally used in sacred rites.
Millwood is a land of primitive earth worship where chieftain knights served as high priests.
title: Earth Seeker

description:
This special ring crafted in an Eastern land is made of gold, but with a wood grain crest on its surface.
The ring slows the loss of weapon durability and is particularly useful to bearers of delicate swords crafted in the East.
title: East Wood Grain Ring

description:
A wooden kite shaped shield. It is decorated with the ancient symbol of a double-headed eagle, painted yellow.
Wooden shields are lighter than metal shields, but with lower physical damage reduction, and reduced shield stability.
title: East-West Shield

description:
A wooden shield decorated with the ancient symbol of the two-headed eagle. Close to a small shield in size.
Wooden shields are light, manageable, and offer relatively high magic absorption.
title: East-West Shield (Dark Souls III)

description:
A distinctive armor made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, this armor offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.
title: Eastern Armor

description:
Distinctive armor made in an Eastern land.
The exquisite craftsmanship and artistic design made these prized pieces in the collection of any nobleman.
Offers excellent damage absorption, particularly from slashing attacks from katanas, which are commonly encountered threats in battles fought in the East.
title: Eastern Armor (Dark Souls III)

description:
Distinctive gauntlets made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, these gauntlets offer excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.
title: Eastern Gauntlets

description:
Distinctive gauntlets made in an Eastern land.
The exquisite craftsmanship and artistic design made these prized pieces in the collection of any nobleman.
Offers excellent damage absorption, particularly from slashing attacks from katanas, which are commonly encountered threats in battles fought in the East.
title: Eastern Gauntlets (Dark Souls III)

description:
A distinctive helm made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, this helm offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.
title: Eastern Helm

description:
Distinctive helm made in an Eastern land.
The exquisite craftsmanship and artistic design made these prized pieces in the collection of any nobleman.
Offers excellent damage absorption, particularly from slashing attacks from katanas, which are commonly encountered threats in battles fought in the East.
title: Eastern Helm (Dark Souls III)

description:
A thick, round metal shield decorated with the unique crest of an eastern land.
Heaviest of the small shields, it is impressively weighty and thus able to deflect attacks with ease.
title: Eastern Iron Shield

description:
Distinctive leggings made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, these leggings offer excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.
title: Eastern Leggings

description:
Distinctive leggings made in an Eastern land.
The exquisite craftsmanship and artistic design made these prized pieces in the collection of any nobleman.
Offers excellent damage absorption, particularly from slashing attacks from katanas, which are commonly encountered threats in battles fought in the East.
title: Eastern Leggings (Dark Souls III)

description:
Frightful occult shield. Defends against divine weapons and lightning.
In an ill-fated plot to destroy the very gods, the followers of the occult once attempted to steal the power of Gravelord Nito, the first of the dead.
title: Effigy Shield

description:
A strange weapon found among malformed inhabitants of the Profaned Capital.
The Profaned Flame was triggered by the curse of these women, relatives of a certain oracle, but despite their culpability, they went on living without any cares.
title: Eleonora

description:
Curved sword forged from the soul of Alsanna. Formed by two curious blades, this sword can restore an ally's HP with a hit from its strong attack.
The enigmatic Alsanna quietly found a place at the Ivory King's side, and when his strength was fully drained, he conferred this sword, inscribed with the name of the land, to her.
title: Eleum Loyce

description:
Armor of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora, based on the fire-warding heraldic symbol on its blue surcoat.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.
title: Elite Knight Armor

description:
Armor made of bradden steel. Provides sturdy defense, making it an old-time favorite of elite knights.
Bradden steel is used widely in Drangleic. This fine alloy is made from ores mined in the southern kingdom.
title: Elite Knight Armor (Dark Souls II)

description:
Armor said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.
The mere mention of Astora invoked wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.
title: Elite Knight Armor (Dark Souls III)

description:
Gauntlets of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.
title: Elite Knight Gauntlets

description:
Gauntlets said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.
The mere mention of Astora invoked wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.
title: Elite Knight Gauntlets (Dark Souls III)

description:
Gloves made of bradden steel. They provide sturdy defense, making them an old-time favorite of elite knights.
Bradden steel is used widely in Drangleic. This fine alloy is made from ores mined in the southern kingdom.
title: Elite Knight Gloves (Dark Souls II)

description:
Helm of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.
title: Elite Knight Helm

description:
Helmet made of bradden steel. Provides sturdy defense, making it an old-time favorite of elite knights.
Bradden steel is used widely in Drangleic. This fine alloy is made from ores mined in the southern kingdom.
title: Elite Knight Helm (Dark Souls II)

description:
Helm said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.
